question: What are the symptoms of an incidental durotomy (ID).
ideal_answer: Incidental durotomy can cause postural headaches, nausea, vomiting, dizziness, photophobia, tinnitus, and vertigo. Meningitis is a rare complication reported to occur with a frequency of 0.18%

snippets.text: Incidental durotomy can cause postural headaches, nausea, vomiting, dizziness, photophobia, tinnitus, and vertigo.
Despite the frequency of dural tears in spinal surgery, meningitis is a rare complication reported to occur with a frequency of 0.18%.

exact_answer: postural headaches, vomiting, dizziness, photophobia, tinnitus, vertigo, menningitis
